titleAscii.titlePartAscii: Wafer test cassette system for holding semiconductor wafer used for manufacturing of microelectronic device, has alignment elements constraining relative movement of base and probe card assembly in direction parallel to receiving surface

titleEnhanced.title: Wafer test cassette system for holding semiconductor wafer used for manufacturing of microelectronic device, has alignment elements constraining relative movement of base and probe card assembly in direction parallel to receiving surface

noveltyAscii.paraAscii: The system (100) has a base (102) having a fiducial (104), a receiving surface (106) to receive a wafer (150) and alignment elements (108). A probe card assembly (120) has probes (124) arranged on surface (126) of a substrate (122) and alignment elements (128) corresponding to the alignment elements (108). The alignment elements constrain relative movement of base and probe card assembly in direction parallel to receiving surface while permitting relative movement of base and probe card assembly in direction perpendicular to the receiving surface.

descriptionAscii.paraAscii: INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the following:
(1) method of providing electrical contacts to terminals arranged on wafer; and

useAscii.paraAscii: Wafer test cassette system for holding semiconductor wafer used for manufacturing of microelectronic device such as singulated and unsingulated semiconductor dies.

advantageAscii.paraAscii: The bases have small thermal mass than probe card assembly so that the bases and wafers are cooled or heated quickly. Thus the overall test time is reduced. The temperatures can be selected so that the thermal strains of the wafer at two temperatures can be matched. Thus the alignment errors caused by temperature-induced dimensional changes in base, wafer and probe card assembly can be minimized. Since the height of the compression stops is adjusted before or during the loading of wafer on the base based on a nominal height of the wafer, production of predefined amount of overtravel during the vertical transition of the base on the probe card assembly can be ensured. Since the probe card assembly is urged in center position relative to base, accurate, reliable positioning of probe card assembly can be achieved, even when temperature difference is present.

descriptionOfDrawingsAscii.paraAsciiSimple: The drawing shows a side view of the wafer cassette system.

abstract.xhtml:div: Wafer cassette systems and methods of using wafer cassette systems. A wafer cassette system can include a base and a probe card assembly. The base and the probe card assembly can each include complementary interlocking alignment elements. The alignment elements can constrain relative movement of the base and probe card assembly in directions parallel to a wafer receiving surface of the base, while permitting relative movement in a direction perpendicular to the receiving surface.

xhtml:ol.xhtml:li:
1 . A wafer cassette system for holding a wafer comprising:
a base comprising a fiducial, a receiving surface sized to receive said wafer, and a plurality of first alignment elements;
a probe card assembly comprising a substrate, a plurality of probes disposed on a surface of said substrate and arranged to contact terminals of said wafer, and a plurality of second alignment elements corresponding to said first alignment elements; and
wherein said first alignment elements and said second alignment elements comprise complementary shapes capable of interlocking to constrain relative movement of said base and said probe card assembly in directions substantially parallel to said receiving surface while permitting relative movement of said base and said probe card assembly in a direction substantially perpendicular to said receiving surface.

titles.title: WAFER TEST CASSETTE SYSTEM
SYSTÈME DE CASSETTE D'EXAMEN DE PLAQUETTES

abstract.xhtml:div: Wafer cassette systems and methods of using wafer cassette systems. A wafer cassette system can include a base and a probe card assembly. The base and the probe card assembly can each include complementary interlocking alignment elements. The alignment elements can constrain relative movement of the base and probe card assembly in directions parallel to a wafer receiving surface of the base, while permitting relative movement in a direction perpendicular to the receiving surface.

La présente invention se rapporte à des systèmes de cassette de plaquettes et à des procédés d'utilisation des systèmes de cassettes de plaquettes. Un système de cassette de plaquettes peut comprendre une base et un ensemble carte sonde. La base et l'ensemble carte sonde peuvent chacun comprendre d'autres éléments d'alignement à emboîtement. Les éléments d'alignement peuvent forcer la base et l'ensemble carte sonde à avoir un mouvement relatif dans des directions parallèles à une surface de réception de plaquette de la base tout en permettant un mouvement relatif dans une direction perpendiculaire à la surface de réception.

abstract.xhtml:p: Wafer cassette systems and methods of using wafer cassette systems. A wafer cassette system can include a base and a probe card assembly. The base and the probe card assembly can each include complementary interlocking alignment elements. The alignment elements can constrain relative movement of the base and probe card assembly in directions parallel to a wafer receiving surface of the base, while permitting relative movement in a direction perpendicular to the receiving surface.

claims.claim: It is the wafer cassette system for maintaining the wafer.Base which comprises the start point, the receiving surface having the size for accommodating the wafer, and the multiple first align membersThe probe card assembly including substrate, and second align members of the plurality corresponding to first align members and the multiple probes is included, and second align members of the plurality corresponding to first align members and the multiple probes is arranged to be arranged on the surface of the substrate and contact with the terminals of the wafer.The wafer cassette system which includes the linked complementary shapes in order to restrict the relative motion of base and probe card assembly about the receiving surface in substantially parallel to directions while it allows the relative motion of base and probe card assembly in the direction in which first align members and second align members are the receiving surface, substantially, the right angle.

abstract.xhtml:p: Wafer cassette systems and methods of using wafer cassette systems. A wafer cassette system can include a base and a probe card assembly. The base and the probe card assembly can each include complementary interlocking alignment elements. The alignment elements can constrain relative movement of the base and probe card assembly in directions parallel to a wafer receiving surface of the base, while permitting relative movement in a direction perpendicular to the receiving surface.

Wafer cassette systems and methods of using wafer cassette systems. A wafer cassette system can include a base and a probe card assembly. The base and the probe card assembly can each include complementary interlocking alignment elements. The alignment elements can constrain relative movement of the base and probe card assembly in directions parallel to a wafer receiving surface of the base, while permitting relative movement in a direction perpendicular to the receiving surface.

abstract.xhtml:div: Wafer cassette systems and methods of using wafer cassette systems. A wafer cassette system can include a base and a probe card assembly. The base and the probe card assembly can each include complementary interlocking alignment elements. The alignment elements can constrain relative movement of the base and probe card assembly in directions parallel to a wafer receiving surface of the base, while permitting relative movement in a direction perpendicular to the receiving surface.

claims.claim: A wafer cassette system for holding a wafer comprising: a base comprising a fiducial, a receiving surface sized to receive said wafer, and a plurality of first alignment elements; a probe card assembly comprising a substrate, a plurality of probes arranged to contact terminals of said wafer, and a plurality of second alignment elements corresponding to said first alignment elements; and wherein said first alignment elements and said second alignment elements comprise complementary shapes capable of interlocking, wherein while interlocked, each pair of one of said first alignment elements interlocked with one of said second alignment elements constrains movement of one of said base or said probe card assembly relative to the other of said base or said probe card assembly in at least a first direction that is substantially parallel to said receiving surface while permitting relative movement of said one of said base or said probe card assembly relative to the other of said base or said probe card assembly in a direction substantially perpendicular to said receiving surface, and wherein while interlocked, each said pair of one of said first alignment elements interlocked with one of said second alignment elements permits movement of said one of said base or said probe card assembly relative to the other of said base or said probe card assembly in a second direction that is substantially perpendicular to said first direction and substantially parallel to said receiving surface.

litCitation.litCitationTotal: Written Opinion of the Int'l Searching Authority, PCT/US2010/062260 (Sep. 14, 2011), 5 pages.

abstract.xhtml:p: A microelectronics element (for example, chip|tip (dies)) is normally produced in large quantities on a semiconductor wafer.For various reasons, the microelectronics element may not operate|move correctly.Therefore, the various tests of a microelectronics element are normally done as a part of manufacturing process.There exist a functional test, a rate test, classification|selection, an electricity supply test etc. as a test.The (For example, before making a microelectronics element separate at the process called dicing (singulation)) test in a wafer level is done in many cases so that the element which becomes unsatisfactory may be known before an assembly of an element.

claims.claim: It is a wafer cassette system for hold|maintaining a wafer,Comprising:The base which has a reference|standard part, the acceptance surface of the magnitude|size which receives the said wafer, and a some 1st position alignment element,Board|substrate,The some probe arranged so that it might arrange|position on the surface of the said board|substrate and the terminal of the said wafer might be contact|connected,The probe card assembly which has a some 2nd position alignment element corresponding to the said 1st position alignment element is provided,The said 1st position alignment element and the said 2nd position alignment element have a complementary shape which can be connected,Each of one of the said 1st position alignment elements and one group of the said 2nd position alignment element connected with this,Accept|permitting the other relative displacement|movement with respect to the one of the said base in the direction substantially perpendicular|vertical to the said acceptance surface, and the said probe card assembly during connection.The other movement with respect to the one of the said base in the substantially parallel direction of the at least 1st and the said probe card assembly is regulated on the said acceptance surface,Each of the said group is a system which accept|permits the other relative displacement|movement with respect to the one of the said base in a 2nd direction substantially parallel on the said acceptance surface substantially perpendicular|vertical in said 1st direction and, and the said probe card assembly during connection.
